title: IV Crush (The Earnings Trap)
badge_description: You understand the earnings trap and will never fall for it again

screens.headline: Why did you lose money even though you were RIGHT?
screens.text: IV CRUSH. You bought calls, earnings beat, stock up 5%, but your calls LOST money. This destroys beginners every earnings season. Here's how to avoid it.

screens.headline: IV Crush: The Post-Event Collapse
screens.text: IV Crush is the massive drop in implied volatility immediately after binary events (earnings, FDA decisions, elections). Options can lose 30-50% of value overnight even if you're RIGHT about direction. Why? Uncertainty resolved = IV collapses = vega crushes you.

screens.headline: IV Crush is Like Concert Tickets After the Show
screens.text: Before concert: Tickets sell for $500 (high uncertainty - will it be good?). After concert: Tickets worth $0 even if it was AMAZING. Uncertainty gone = value collapses. Options before earnings = high IV. After earnings = IV crashes.

reveal_sections.label: Before event: High IV = uncertainty premium baked in
After event: Uncertainty gone = IV collapses
Even correct direction can't save you from vega loss
Delta gains < Vega losses = net loss despite being right

screens.question: When does IV Crush happen?
options: After binary events (earnings, FDA, elections) when uncertainty resolves
screens.explanation_correct: Exactly! IV inflates BEFORE uncertainty (earnings, FDA approval, election). The moment uncertainty resolves (results announced), IV COLLAPSES. Predictable as clockwork.
screens.explanation_wrong: IV Crush is predictable: happens after BINARY EVENTS when uncertainty resolves. Earnings most common, but also FDA decisions, court rulings, elections.

screens.question: Day before TSLA earnings: Stock $250, IV 110%. You buy $260 call for $18 (vega 0.15). Earnings beat! Stock jumps to $267.50 (+7%). Next day call worth $14. What happened?
options: Delta gain (+$3.75) was smaller than vega loss (-$7.50) from IV crush
screens.explanation_correct: PERFECT! This IS IV crush. Delta 0.50 Ã— $7.50 move = +$3.75 gain. BUT IV crashed from 110% to 60% (-50% IV). Vega 0.15 Ã— -50 IV = -$7.50 loss. Net: -$3.75. You were RIGHT but LOST money!
screens.explanation_wrong: Break it down: Delta gain = 0.50 Ã— $7.50 = +$3.75. Vega loss = 0.15 Ã— -50% IV drop Ã— 100 shares = -$7.50. Vega loss > Delta gain = Net loss. This is the earnings trap!

teaching_points: Even +8% stock move can result in -20% option loss

cards.back: Uncertainty resolves after binary events. Before = high IV (fear). After = low IV (known outcome). Vega collapses.

cards.front: Can you be right and lose?
cards.back: YES! Stock moves in your favor but vega loss exceeds delta gain. This happens CONSTANTLY at earnings.
1) Don't buy before earnings 2) Sell premium instead 3) Use spreads (vega neutral) 4) Wait until AFTER announcement
Option SELLERS. They collect inflated premiums before event, then watch them collapse. Buy back cheap after.
